title: ML: Detecting Overfitting
story: Overfitting = memorizing training data instead of learning patterns. Signs: high train score, low test score!
instructions: Detect overfitting. Print 1 if the model is overfitting (train_acc > 0.95 and test_acc < 0.7), else print 0. Given train_acc=0.98, test_acc=0.65.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

train_acc = 0.98
test_acc = 0.65

# Detect overfitting
is_overfitting = (train_acc > 0.95) and (test_acc < 0.7)

if is_overfitting:
    print(1)
else:
    print(0)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

train_acc = 0.98
test_acc = 0.65

is_overfitting = (train_acc > 0.95) and (test_acc < 0.7)

if is_overfitting:
    print(1)
else:
    print(0)

tests.expectedBehavior: Detect large gap between train and test performance

hints.text: Overfitting: train_acc > 0.95 AND test_acc < 0.7. Check both conditions.
98% train but 65% test = overfitting! Model memorized training data.
